pullRequest.title: CB-6644 Auditing environment
pullRequest.bodyText: The structured event moved to a different module, named as 'structuredevent-service-legacy'. In this modul the functionalities are untouched. For the CDP world, we created two new modules: 'structuredevent-api-cdp' and 'structuredevent-service-cdp'. We created a common endpoint, service and repository. Only one thing need to integrate: the domain SQL.

afterCommit.message: The structured event moved to a different module, named as 'structuredevent-service-legacy'. In this modul the functionalities are untouched. For the CDP world, we created two new modules: 'structuredevent-api-cdp' and 'structuredevent-service-cdp'. We created a common endpoint, service and repository. Only one thing need to integrate: the domain SQL.

nodes.bodyText: could you add an else branch or restructure the code so you won't have a return in the middle of the method?
object->array
could you check if we really need this transactional annotation?
why null?
missing unit test, especially for pattern matching
I would prefer if you would add an getEnvironmentById method to the EnvironmentService and that could throw an exception as I see this kind of usage a lot in the code generally
I see you have created CDPStructuredFlowEventFactory and this is the only implementation of that interface. And 2 of 3 methods return null. Why do we need these methods?
I see no reason to introduce msg here, you could just use serializedPayload
there is already a TransformGetterType in the codebase, is it possible to reuse that one? same applies for Immutable
maybe add json ignore unknown annotation also
this might worth a simple unit test
why not initialize the field with a Collections.emptyList() and then the getter won't have any logic. At least I think we usually handle this way. same applies to the others
do we need these or could be deleted? if can be then you should return in the first line and you don't need the state variaable
I think T should be serializable
why do we need this max? duration can be negative?
these 2 could be static final variable
why these null initializations required? the same for those in the other constructors
are we sure restcall has always a non null restresponse? I don't see anything in RestCallDetails what would ensure that
do we need this empty class?
it's a bit hard to follow this method, similarly to getResourceId. Could you refactor this a bit to make it more readable?
please add unit tests
not used anywhere
could you break up this method? it too long and could be refactored
please don't return in the middle of the method, at least add an else branch

this is a bit complicated class with a lot of logic and hard to follow/understand. no one would dare to touch it if you don't cover this with unit tests pretty well.
also some refactor would be nice, the high number of Autowires indicate the same also that maybe the whole class could be refactored into smaller ones which is easier to understand, maintain and test
maybe @NotEmpty would fit better. Should we add this to the other public methods definition also?
please add unit tests
unit test
shall we log the source to know what we can't convert?
this field is unnecessary and misleading. could you remove this?
do we need this class?
